title: St Just Walks - Coastal Walk to Cape Cornwall and Land's End

description: St Just in Penwith is notable as the most westerly town in mainland Britain. It's a great place for walking with beautiful coastline and a series of interesting old mines to explore. This coastal walk from the town takes you to the lovely Cape Cornwall and then on to Land's End at the western tip of the country. It's about a 7 mile walk running along a section of the epic South West Coast Path. The walk starts in the village and follows country lanes west to Cape Cornwall. Here you can enjoy some glorious views to the Isles of Scilly and Land's End. The walk then heads south along the undulating cliff top path to Porth Nanven in the wildlife rich Cot Valley before coming to the lovely Sennen Cove . You continue to Land's End, passing the beautiful beaches at Whitesand Bay on the way. Here you can pick up the Land's End Trail which runs for over 300 miles to Avebury in Wiltshire.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the north you can visit the Kenidjack Valley, the Levant Mine and the Botallack Mine where you can explore the industrial mining heritage of the area. A few miles to the east you can pick up the Penwith Moors and Men-An-Tol Walk. This fascinating walk visits several ancient sites including Men-An-Tol standing stones and the Lanyon Quoit dolmen. You'll also pass the remains of the old Ding Dong Mines and climb to the fine viewpoint at Carn Galver.

district: St Just / St Just in Penwith
